law.text: If the owner or operator of any licensed stockyard in this state is required by law or shall have any reason to utilize the services of a veterinarian, the veterinarian shall be chosen by the owner or operator of the stockyards, and may be relieved of his duties at the pleasure of the owner or operator. Any veterinarian so employed shall be licensed by the Kentucky Board of Veterinary Examiners and accredited by the United States Department of Agriculture.
law.history: Amended 2006 Ky. Acts ch. 225, sec. 8, effective July 12, 2006. -- Created 1958 Ky. Acts ch. 107, sec. 1, effective June 19, 1958.
